div.l: Ther lyeth vppon̄ me wombe and on myn hede
Helpe Simkyn̄ for the fals clerkes fight
This Iohn sterte vp as faste as euer he might
And gropid be the walle to and fro
To fynde a staffe and she sterte vp also
And knewe þe esters better than did Iohn
And by the walle a staffe she toke anone
And sawe a litill Shymryng of a light
For atte an hole yn shone the mone light
And by that light she sawe them bothe two
But sekirly she wiste not who was who
And as she sawe a white thinge in here ye
And whan she gan this white thinge aspye
She wende the clerke had a voluper
And with the staffe she drewe ay nere ⁊and nere
And wende haue hit this Aleyn̄ atte fulle
And smote the Miller on the pilled sculle
That doun̄ he gothe and cried harowe I dye
This clerke bete him well and lette him lye
And arraied hem and toke her hors anone
And eke theire mele ⁊and on thaire wey gone
And atte Mille dore thei toke theire kake
Of halfe a busshell flour͗e well y bake
Thus is the proude Miller well y bete
And hathe loste the gryndingꝭe of his whete
And paide for the super eủery dele
Of Aleyn̄ and Iohn and bete him well
His wife is swyued and his dought̉er als
Lo swiche it is a Miller to be fals
And there to this ꝓprouerbe is saide full sothe
Him dare not wene well that euill dothe
A gilour shall him selfe begilid be
And god that sittith hye in maieste
Saue alle this Cumpany grete ⁊and smale
Thus haue I quitte the Millers tale
⁊And her͗e begynnith the man of lawes ꝓprolog and his tale seweth of Constance
Oure hoste sawe well þat the bright sonne
The arke of his artificiall day haþ ronne
The forth parte and halfe an oure more
And though he were not depe sterte in lore
He wiste it was the xviij day
Of Aprill that messenger is to May
And sawe well that the shadowe of eủery tre
Was as in lengthe the same quantite
That was the body erecte that causeth it
